publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-857 Mr Duncan McNeil: Gourock/Dunoon Ferry Service—That the Parliament welcomes the commitment by the Minister for Transport and the Environment to make strong representations to the European Commission for the Gourock/Dunoon ferry service to be included in the wider CalMac tendering process; notes that vehicular transport on the service receives no public subsidy at present; further notes that nothing in the current proposals precludes CalMac from continuing to carry vehicles; and recognises that, to have the best chance of securing the long-term future of the service, all interested parties should support the Minister in her negotiations with the Commission to the fullest of their ability.

S1M-857 Mr Duncan McNeil: Gourock/Dunoon Ferry Service—That the Parliament welcomes the commitment by the Minister for Transport and the Environment to make strong representations to the European Commission for the Gourock/Dunoon ferry service to be included in the wider CalMac tendering process; notes that vehicular transport on the service receives no public subsidy at present; further notes that nothing in the current proposals precludes CalMac from continuing to carry vehicles; and recognises that, to have the best chance of securing the long-term future of the service, all interested parties should support the Minister in her negotiations with the Commission to the fullest of their ability.
S1M-857 Gourock/Dunoon Ferry Service (lodged on 15 May 2000) George Lyon*

S1M-857 Mr Duncan McNeil: Gourock/Dunoon Ferry Service—That the Parliament welcomes the commitment by the Minister for Transport and the Environment to make strong representations to the European Commission for the Gourock/Dunoon ferry service to be included in the wider CalMac tendering process; notes that vehicular transport on the service receives no public subsidy at present; further notes that nothing in the current proposals precludes CalMac from continuing to carry vehicles; and recognises that, to have the best chance of securing the long-term future of the service, all interested parties should support the Minister in her negotiations with the Commission to the fullest of their ability. Supported by: George Lyon
S1M-857 Gourock/Dunoon Ferry Service (lodged on 15 May 2000) Rhoda Grant*
S1M-857 Gourock/Dunoon Ferry Service (lodged on 15 May 2000) Mr Michael McMahon*

S1M-857 Mr Duncan McNeil: Gourock/Dunoon Ferry Service-That the Parliament welcomes the commitment by the Minister for Transport and the Environment to make strong representations to the European Commission for the Gourock/Dunoon ferry service to be included in the wider CalMac tendering process; notes that vehicular transport on the service receives no public subsidy at present; further notes that nothing in the current proposals precludes CalMac from continuing to carry vehicles; and recognises that, to have the best chance of securing the long-term future of the service, all interested parties should support the Minister in her negotiations with the Commission to the fullest of their ability. Supported by: George Lyon, Rhoda Grant, Mr Michael McMahon

S1M-857 Mr Duncan McNeil: Gourock/Dunoon Ferry Service-That the Parliament welcomes the commitment by the Minister for Transport and the Environment to make strong representations to the European Commission for the Gourock/Dunoon ferry service to be included in the wider CalMac tendering process; notes that vehicular transport on the service receives no public subsidy at present; further notes that nothing in the current proposals precludes CalMac from continuing to carry vehicles; and recognises that, to have the best chance of securing the long-term future of the service, all interested parties should support the Minister in her negotiations with the Commission to the fullest of their ability. Supported by: George Lyon, Rhoda Grant, Mr Michael McMahon
S1M-857 Gourock/Dunoon Ferry Service (lodged on 15 May 2000) Trish Godman*
S1M-857 Gourock/Dunoon Ferry Service (lodged on 15 May 2000) Cathy Jamieson*

S1M-857 Mr Duncan McNeil: Gourock/Dunoon Ferry Service—That the Parliament welcomes the commitment by the Minister for Transport and the Environment to make strong representations to the European Commission for the Gourock/Dunoon ferry service to be included in the wider CalMac tendering process; notes that vehicular transport on the service receives no public subsidy at present; further notes that nothing in the current proposals precludes CalMac from continuing to carry vehicles; and recognises that, to have the best chance of securing the long-term future of the service, all interested parties should support the Minister in her negotiations with the Commission to the fullest of their ability. Supported by: George Lyon, Rhoda Grant, Mr Michael McMahon, Trish Godman, Cathy Jamieson

S1M-857 Mr Duncan McNeil: Gourock/Dunoon Ferry Service—That the Parliament welcomes the commitment by the Minister for Transport and the Environment to make strong representations to the European Commission for the Gourock/Dunoon ferry service to be included in the wider CalMac tendering process; notes that vehicular transport on the service receives no public subsidy at present; further notes that nothing in the current proposals precludes CalMac from continuing to carry vehicles; and recognises that, to have the best chance of securing the long-term future of the service, all interested parties should support the Minister in her negotiations with the Commission to the fullest of their ability. Supported by: George Lyon, Rhoda Grant, Mr Michael McMahon, Trish Godman, Cathy Jamieson

S1M-857 Mr Duncan McNeil: Gourock/Dunoon Ferry Service—That the Parliament welcomes the commitment by the Minister for Transport and the Environment to make strong representations to the European Commission for the Gourock/Dunoon ferry service to be included in the wider CalMac tendering process; notes that vehicular transport on the service receives no public subsidy at present; further notes that nothing in the current proposals precludes CalMac from continuing to carry vehicles; and recognises that, to have the best chance of securing the long-term future of the service, all interested parties should support the Minister in her negotiations with the Commission to the fullest of their ability. Supported by: George Lyon, Rhoda Grant, Mr Michael McMahon, Trish Godman, Cathy Jamieson
